mmWaveLink FTDI Framework

Introduction

As mentioned in the User Guide, the mmWaveStudio uses underlying C DLLs to communicate with the mmWave Devices.These DLL's contains a generic component which is referred to as Mmwavelink.
Mmwavelink handles the communication protocol between the Host (in this case a PC) and the mmWave devices. Refer the mmWave Interface Control Document (ICD) to understand the protocol in detail.

  • Although Mmwavelink handles the protocol, it still needs to send and receive data over MicroUSB cable to the FTDI Chip (on the Devpack or the DCA1000).
  • An FTDI port layer is responsible for sending the message over MicroUSB cable to the FTDI chip.
  • The FTDI chip then converts this data into SPI signals to communicate with the device.
    For more detailed information, refer mmwl_port_ftdi

The following diagram explains the whole flow and the place of the port layer in the whole sequence flow.

Note
1: The source code for mmWavelink is shared as part of the DFP release.
